titleproper.value: Guide to the Russian Artillery Commission in North America Records <num>TAM.026</num>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

unittitle.value: Russian Artillery Commission in North America Records

abstract.value: The Russian Artillery Commission was based in New York; its mission was to negotiate purchase of munitions and other artillery supplies for the Imperial Russian government. The records include correspondence with U.S. and Canadian firms discussing manufacturing specifications and equipment, production estimates, inspection procedures, and order arrangements. Also includes reports and notes of Ordnance Colonel V. Nekrasov and other papers. The records are mostly in Russian.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Russian Artillery Commission in North America Records; TAM 026; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Collection was transferred to New York University from the Rand School Archives in 1963. There is no earlier provenance information. The accession number 1963.006 is associated with this collection.
The Russian Artillery Commission was based in New York; its mission was to negotiate the purchase of munitions and other artillery supplies for the Imperial Russian government.

The records include correspondence with U.S. and Canadian firms discussing manufacturing specifications and equipment, production estimates, inspection procedures, and order arrangements. Also includes reports and notes of Ordnance Colonel V. Nekrasov and other papers. Chiefly in Russian.

corpname.value: Russian Artillery Commission in North America
